intro: Ida hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy ida, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in summer. Ida hirtzii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant.
